test.test_name: Time formats should be set in Globalization Attributes
test.query_clob:
select case when date_format = '&AI_FMT_DATE.'
          and date_time_format = '&AI_FMT_DATETIME.'
          and timestamp_format = '&AI_FMT_TIMESTAMP.'
          and timestamp_tz_format = '&AI_FMT_TIMESTAMP_TZ.'
          then 'Y'
          else 'N'
          end pass_yn,
       aa.workspace,
       aa.application_id, 
       null page_id,
       aa.created_by,
       aa.created_on,
       aa.last_updated_by,
       aa.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) has incorrect time formats set [`%2`, `%3`, `%4`, `%5`]', 
        p0 => aa.application_name, 
        p1 => aa.application_id,
				p2 => date_format, 
			  p3 => date_time_format, 
			  p4 => timestamp_format, 
			  p5 => timestamp_tz_format) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) has incorrect time formats set', 
        p0 => aa.application_name, 
        p1 => aa.application_id) issue_title,
       aa.application_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aa.application_name,
       aa.alias,
       aa.availability_status,
			 date_format, 
			 date_time_format, 
			 timestamp_format, 
			 timestamp_tz_format
from apex_applications aa
inner join v_eba_stds_applications esa on aa.application_id = esa.apex_app_id
                                       and esa.type_code not in ('DEVUTIL')
where aa.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
test.explanation: It's important to standardize how we handle date time values
test.fix:
Go to Application Definition > Globalization and set the followin values

1.  Application Date Dormat should be '&AI\_FMT\_DATE.'
2.  Application Date Time Format should be '&AI\_FMT\_DATETIME.'
3.  Application Timestamp Format should be '&AI\_FMT\_TIMESTAMP.'
4.  Application Timestamp Timezone Format should be '&AI\_FMT\_TIMESTAMP\_TZ.'
